title: Comparative Instructional Design in Experimental Task Environments for Enhancing Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and foundational problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, exploring problem-solving strategies through parallel VR simulations and real-world task execution

learning_goals: Learners can perform experimental tasks in diverse problem-solving environments and explain strategies for managing working memory load.
Learners can compare differences in problem-solving time and strategies across three task environments (virtual simulation, mental reasoning, and physical manipulation).
Learners can analyze the impact of experience level and environmental conditions on performance during the Tower of Hanoi problem-solving process.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
